full_summary:
**Electrical Services - Cape Breton Field Unit**
=====================================================

### Solicitation Number
#### 5P300-23-0234/A

### Description of the Tender
------------------------------------------

The Parks Canada Agency is seeking a Standing Offer Agreement to provide Electrical Services on an as-requested basis to the Cape Breton Field Unit. This is a two-year agreement starting July 1, 2024, and ending June 30, 2026, with an optional one-year extension. The electrical contractor will be required to perform small electrical contracts throughout the Cape Breton Field Unit.

### Requirements
-----------------

Requirements for the Standing Offer Agreement include:

- Performing electrical contracts at 7 locations within the Cape Breton area.
- Delivering services in accordance with the National Parks Regulations, which include adherence to the ordinances, laws, rules, and regulations set out in the National Park Act.
- Maintaining a high level of health and safety standards in accordance with relevant regulations.

### Tender Closing Date
----------------------

The tender closing date is June 17, 2024, at 14:00:00.

### Bidding Instructions
-------------------------

Bidders are required to submit their bids via fax or email. The only acceptable email address for responses to the bid solicitation is [soumissionsest-bidseast@pc.gc.ca](mailto:soumissionsest-bidseast@pc.gc.ca). Bids submitted by email directly to the Contracting Authority or to any email address other than the noted above will not be accepted.

The maximum email file size that Parks Canada is capable of receiving is 15 megabytes.

### Contact Information
-------------------------

Enquiries regarding this solicitation must be submitted in writing and should be received no later than five (5) calendar days prior to the date set for solicitation closing to allow sufficient time to provide a response.

National Parks Regulations require that all work is to be performed in accordance with the ordinances, laws, rules, and regulations set out in the National Park Act.

Documents may be submitted in either official language of Canada. Parks Canada has made every effort to provide equivalent documents in both official languages, however, if you find any discrepancies between the English and French documents, please notify the Contracting Officer listed in this opportunity as soon as possible so that we can rectify the situation.

The Crown retains the right to negotiate with suppliers on any procurement.

Note: All anomalies and inconsistencies were removed, and text reorganized for enhanced readability. The text was shortened to 400 words and ph
